api_key.description: The API Key to use when connecting to Seq. This can also be set with the `SEQ_API_KEY` environment variable.

retry_max.description: The number of HTTP request retries.

retry_wait_max.description: The maximum time in seconds to wait between HTTP request attempts.

retry_wait_min.description: The minimum time in seconds to wait between HTTP request attempts.

server_url.description: The HTTP endpoint address of the Seq server. This can also be set with the `SEQ_SERVER_URL` environment variable.

display_name.description: An optional display name to aid in identifying the admin user.

must_change_password.description: If `true`, the admin user will be unable to log in without first changing their password.

password.description: The password for the admin user.

username.description: The username that uniquely identifies the admin user.

block.description: Use this resource to manage the admin user on the Seq server.

assigned_permissions.description: List of permissions assigned to the API key. Possible values are `Ingest`, `Read`, `Setup` and `Write`.

is_default.description: If `true`, the key is the built-in (tokenless) API key representing unauthenticated HTTP ingestion.

owner_id.description: The id of the user for whom this is a personal API key.

title.description: A title for the API key.

token.description: A pre-allocated API key token; by default, a new token will be generated.

token_prefix.description: A few characters from the start of the `token` stored as plain text, to aid in identifying tokens.

block.description: Use this resource to create and manage API keys.

automatically_refresh.description: If the license is for a subscription, automatically check datalust.co and update the license when the subscription is renewed or tier changed.

can_renew_online_now.description: If `true`, the license can be renewed online.

is_single_user.description: If `true`, the server is using the default license which allows a single person to access the Seq server.

is_valid.description: Whether or not the license is valid for the server.

license_text.description: The cryptographically-signed certificate that describes the license.

licensed_users.description: The number of users licensed to access the Seq server, or `null` if the license has no user limit.

status_description.description: Information about the status of the license.

subscription_id.description: If the license is a subscription, the subscription id.

block.description: Use this resource to update the Seq license.

authentication_provider.description: The authentication provider to use. Allowed values are `Active Directory`, `Azure Active Directory` and `OpenID Connect`.

automatic_access_ad_group.description: The name of an Active Directory group within which users will be automatically be granted user access to Seq.

automatically_provision_authenticated_us.description: If `true`, users authenticated with the configured authentication provider be automatically granted default user access to Seq.

azuread_authority.description: The AAD authority. The default is `login.windows.net`.

azuread_client_id.description: The Azure Active Directory client id.

azuread_client_key.description: The Azure Active Directory client key.

azuread_tenant_id.description: The Azure Active Directory tenant id.

backup_location.description: Server-local filesystem location where automatic backups are stored.

backups_to_keep.description: The UTC time of day to record new backups.

check_for_package_updates.description: If `true`, Seq will periodically check configured NuGet feed for updated versions of installed app packages.

check_for_updates.description: If `true`, Seq will periodically check for new Seq versions.

instance_title.description: A friendly, public, human-readable title identifying this particular Seq instance.

is_authentication_enabled.description: If `true`, the server has authentication enabled.

minimum_free_storage_space.description: The minimum storage space, in bytes, on the disk containing log events, before Seq will stop accepting new events.

new_user_role_ids.description: A comma-separated list of role ids that will be assigned to new users by default.

new_user_show_dashboard_ids.description: A comma-separated list of (shared) dashboard ids that will be included in any new user's personal default workspace.

new_user_show_query_ids.description: A comma-separated list of (shared) SQL query ids that will be included in any new user's personal default workspace.

new_user_show_signal_ids.description: A comma-separated list of (shared) signal ids that will be included in any new user's personal default workspace.

openid_connect_authority.description: If using OpenID Connect authentication, the URL of the authorization endpoint.

openid_connect_client_id.description: If using OpenID Connect, the client id assigned to Seq in the provider.

openid_connect_client_secret.description: If using OpenID Connect, the client secret assigned to Seq in the provider.

openid_connect_scopes.description: If using OpenID Connect, the scopes Seq will request when authorizing the client, as a comma-separated list. For example, `openid, profile, email`.

raw_event_maximum_content_length.description: The maximum size, in bytes of UTF-8-encoded JSON, beyond which individual events will be rejected.

raw_payload_maximum_content_length.description: The maximum size, in HTTP request content bytes, beyond which ingestion requests will be rejected.

require_api_key_for_writing_events.description: If `true`, ingestion requests incoming via HTTP must be authenticated using an API key or logged-in user session. Only effective when `is_authentication_enabled` is `true`.

theme_styles.description: A snippet of CSS that will be included in the front-end's user interface styles.

block.description: Use this resource to manage system settings.

display_name.description: An optional display name to aid in identifying the user.

email_address.description: The user's email address. This will be used to show a Gravatar for the user in some situations.

must_change_password.description: If `true`, the user will be unable to log in without first changing their password. Recommended when administratively assigning a password for the user.

role_ids.description: The ids of one or more roles that grant permissions to the user. Possible values are `role-administrator` (Administrator), `role-ro` (User, read-only), `role-rw` (User, read/write) and `role-user` (User, read/write/ingest)`.

username.description: The username that uniquely identifies the user.

block.description: Use this resource to create a user on the Seq server.
